result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse L Stelton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Probation may petition court for early discharge.
Concurrent with: 11CF209.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office.  Any fine/costs not paid during term of Probation may be reduced to a civil judgment.
$860 restitution to Curtis Lundee - Restitution will be collected through Department of Corrections.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.
May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
May not hold elected office.
If not US citizen may face deportation or potential loss of other civil rights.

Must provide DNA sample - NO surcharge.  
Compas and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Conditional Time - Banked/Stayed for the use by Probation if necessary.

superMiscConds.notes: Must maintain employment during period of supervision.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

No controlled substances without a prescription.  
Not to possess or consume alcohol.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  
If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Any outstanding financial obligation still due and owing are to be paid during period of supervision to the Department of Corrections.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.
Must follow through with all programming deemed necessary by agent.
Must comply with rules of supervision.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: of Completion of Representation
Sentencing Hearing After Revocation 3/25/19
of Notice of Judgment

James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse L Stelton in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Jesse L Stelton in custody.  BJM-clerk 04:02 pm  CT finds Def elig for CIP & SAP.  

SENTENCE:  3 yrs WSP, 1 yr IC, 2 yrs ES, AODA & comply,  No controlled substances without a prescription.  Not to possess or consume alcohol. 343 days sent credit, any amts still due & owing to be paid during supervision.  FTP - judgment, Must maintain employment.  Follow-thru with all programming deemed necessary by DOC.  Must follow thru with rules of supervision.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  If not a U.S. citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR.  4:33 pm adj.
Def's NOH re SAR on 3/25/19 - Return to Sender.  Not Deliverable as Addressed.  Unable to Forward.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 25, 2019 at 03:45 pm.
Donna Burger
